MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Council of Europe Budget Proposals.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for External Affairs what is the attitude of the Government with regard to Opinion Number 46 on the Budget of the Council of Europe for 1967, which was adopted by the Consultative Assembly of the Council of Europe on 28th September 1966; and whether he will instruct the Permanent Representative in the Committee of Ministers of the Council of Europe to vote in favour of the proposals contained in this Opinion.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for External Affairs (Mr. Aiken) Frank Aiken
Speaker.P: This Opinion was examined by the Committee of Ministers at Deputy level and their decision, in which the Irish Representative concurred, was that the very great majority of the estimates submitted by the Assembly were approved, as well as requests for new posts and upgradings.
On three points only—and these were not of a major nature—was the Committee of Ministers unable to approve the requests put forward by the Assembly.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Council of Europe Resolutions.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for External Affairs what is the attitude of the Government with regard to Resolution 319 on Relations between the Consultative Assembly and National Parliaments, which was adopted by the Consultative Assembly of the Council of Europe on 26th September 1966; and, in particular, what action he contemplates taking on paragraph 7 (b) (i) of this Resolution.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for External Affairs (Mr. Aiken) Frank Aiken
Speaker.P: It is my practice to present the Dáil in the annual Estimates for my Department with an account of the part played by Ireland in the Council of Europe and the opportunity is afforded to Deputies to discuss Council of Europe matters in the course of that debate. The Resolution is, therefore, already being largely implemented as far as the Government is concerned. I shall, of course, have regard to the contents of the Resolution in this context in future.

asked the Minister for External Affairs what is the attitude of the Government with regard to Resolution 321 on the general policy of the Council of Europe which was adopted by the Consultative Assembly of the Council of Europe on 28th September, 1966; and what action the Government have taken, or contemplate taking, on it.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for External Affairs (Mr. Aiken) Frank Aiken
Speaker.P: The Government are in general sympathy with the sentiments expressed in Resolution 321 on the general policy of the Council of Europe. The Resolution, however, does not call for any specific action by the Government.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Council of Europe Recommendations.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P.J. Burke Mr. P.J. Burke
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for External Affairs what is the attitude of the Government with regard to Recommendation Number 441 on the ratification of the European Code of Social Security and Protocol thereto which was adopted by the Consultative Assembly of the Council of Europe on 1st October 1965; and whether he will instruct the Permanent Representative in the Committee of Ministers of the Council of Europe to vote in favour of the proposals contained in this recommendation.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for External Affairs (Mr. Aiken) Frank Aiken
Speaker.P: I would refer the Deputy to the reply given to a similar question on 15th December, 1965. The position remains as was indicated in the reply to that question.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. P.J. Burke Mr. P.J. Burke
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for External Affairs what is the attitude of the Government with regard to Recommendation 471 on the self-financing of the European Inter-municipal Exchanges Development Plan which was adopted by the Consultative Assembly of the Council of Europe on 29th September 1966; and whether he will instruct the Permanent Representative in the Committee of Ministers of the Council of Europe to vote in favour of the proposals contained in this Recommendation.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for External Affairs (Mr. Aiken) Frank Aiken
Speaker.P: This Recommendation has been examined by the Committee of Ministers at Deputy level and their decision, in which the Irish Representative concurred, was:
(1) That the grant made under the 1966 Budget for the Intermunicipal Exchange Development Plan should be continued in 1967;

(2) that the question of an increased grant in future and that of the permanent inclusion in the Council's Budget of a sub-head relating to the exchanges should be considered later in the light of the work of the ad hoc Committee of Experts and of a memorandum to be prepared by the Secretariat.
